page.title: 02 WHITLEY BAY (2)
page.content: (4)RESIDENTIAL.A wide range of styles and quality of housing can be found. Whitley Bay was founded by a group of Anglian settlers around the year AD625. The name WHITLEY means Blanch or White Lea or Land,that is dry open Pasture. The first recorded mention of W.Bay was in 11OO when HENRY 1 conferred it on the local PRIORY at TYNEMOUTH.Up to the 17th century the towns growth was slow and based on AGRICULTURE.From 1665-188O its growth was bound up with MINING mainly COAL.The population of the town has grown steadily over the last 2OOyrs 18OO-256 1881-2112 19OO-77O5 197O-37OOO The opening of the NORTH TYNESIDE RAIL- WAY stimulated the towns popularity. Since 188O W.BAY has been essentially a RESIDENTIAL AREA for commercial and industrial workers and a HOLIDAY RESORT for tourists from Scotland and day trippers from the Tyneside Conurbation.
